headline: Trump could flip ‘kill switch’ on payments in the West
summary: Western countries fear that Donald Trump could flip a “kill switch” to disrupt payment systems as a means of pressuring allies, a former Bank of England top official has warned.

raw.headline: Trump could flip ‘kill switch’ on payments in the West
raw.summary: Western countries fear that Donald Trump could flip a “kill switch” to disrupt payment systems as a means of pressuring allies, a former Bank of England top official has warned.

headline: Ex-BoE deputy governor warns Trump could flick financial payments 'kill switch'
summary: LONDON (Reuters) -Countries that see themselves as U.S. allies are now considering whether President Donald Trump's administration could one day disrupt their payments systems to exert diplomatic pressure, a former top Bank of England official has said.  Jon Cunliffe, the BoE's deputy governor for financial stability from 2014 to 2024, said Western countries relied heavily on U.S.-headquartered Visa and Mastercard for day-to-day domestic transactions and found it hard to avoid U.S. banks when making foreign payments.

headline: How Mastercard’s Strong Q1 2025 Earnings Shape Its Investment Outlook
summary: If you own Mastercard stock or are wondering whether now might be the right time to buy in, you are definitely not alone. Mastercard has been making headlines for its consistent ability to capture market share and ride the wave of global digital payments. Over the last year, the company’s share price has risen by 17.7%. If you zoom out a little further, the returns look even more impressive: up 12.3% year-to-date, a remarkable 90.6% over the past three years, and nearly 80% over five years...

headline: Google preps for bot payments
summary: The tech giant launched a payments protocol to address online commerce challenges posed by agentic AI, partnering with Mastercard and PayPal.
